result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory Laron Phillips

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Defendant has pending case before Judge Crivello.  Court will schedule case for same date.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cory Laron Phillips appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Cory Laron Phillips.  Attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court vacated jury trial set for 10-05-2022.  Court set plea/sentencing date.  Court notes for the record that the defendant is compliant with JusticePoint. Case adjourned to Branch 41.  This matter will be held in person in Room 501 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Cory Laron Phillips in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pretrial conference. Final pre-trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Cory L. Phillips, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Cory Laron Phillips in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Case recalled. Defendant appeared late. Court VACATES previously issued bench warrant. Defense counsel requests a status date. Court places case on the trial calendar. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cory Laron Phillips in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Cory Laron Phillips in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cory Laron Phillips appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Branch 35 Judge Rosa Lower number cases pending.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
